creator: Kenneth.Lerman@se-ltd.com
text:
While trying to track down a problem I'm having using ssl, I enable error 
logging at the debug level.  The log showed:

[Mon Jan 20 16:07:03 2003] [debug] ssl_engine_io.c(1027): OpenSSL: read 132/132 
bytes from BIO#bogus %p[mem: bogus %p
                                      k@©i@
[Mon Jan 20 16:07:03 2003] [debug] ssl_engine_io.c(974): +----------------------
---------------------------------------------------

The bogus %p messages are caused by the fact that apr_snprintf "enhances" the 
printf standard in that it requires a modifier of 'p', 'A', or 'I' after a %p.

ssl_engine_io.c(1027) should be modified to change '%p' to '%pp' in two places, 
I believe.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text: This was resolved prior to the 2.0.44 release, please update to that version.
